danfulea.db

Class DatabaseAgentSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.db.DatabaseAgentSupport

  • public class DatabaseAgentSupport
extends java.lang.Object

    This class extends the functionality of the core DatabaseAgent. It is intended to be as fast as possible for database manipulations by keeping these operations at Database Management System (DMS like derby, MySQL,etc.) level. This includes:

    No updating id column to be always in order 1,2,3...

    No fancy sorting data using JTable header

    Working with tables having an auto-increment primary key column or with tables having reserved one column of integer type for sole purpose of mimicking the missing auto-increment primary key column. Usually this column is named ID or NRCRT or Unique_ID etc. There are very few exception for this rule: when no single column act as unique but a combination of columns as in the case of nested tables which have no nested tables themselves. Moreover, if nested tables are huge as in the case of HpGe spectrum details then makes a lot o sense to not have a valid primary key. In this case, insertAll method is more appropriate to be used.

    Other feature is GUI support for viewing or sorting data, i.e JTable, JCombobox and JLabel.

    This class can be extended to provide a new layer of functionality such as working with java objects, i.e all database operations are directly related to java objects making the proper conversions to the required arrays (ORM, Object Relational Mapping technique). A common scenario is to use the java class members as database table column names. Therefore, build the column names array by accessing class member via java reflection API (e.g. TestClass.class.getDeclaredFields();) and save/retrieve data via setters and getters. Spring or Hibernate are java frameworks which are designed to work with java reflection and uses ORM technique. BUT, according to Oracle documentation, the java reflection technique should be avoided in sections of code which are called frequently in performance-sensitive applications. Hence, we also discourage such techniques. In addition, modern applications uses GUI so why on earth do we want to fetch data from GUI fields (e.g. JTextField) create an object out of it and save in database (ORM technique) when we can simply save raw data directly?

    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 04 AUG. 2016

        private java.lang.String primaryKey

      • primaryKeyColumnIndex

        private int primaryKeyColumnIndex
        stores the index of primary key column to be used when building usefullColumnNameArray. Default value is 0, i.e. the first column in table.

        private boolean hasValidAIColumn
        If table was created with auto-increment option this is true.

        private int mimicAI
        For backward compatibility with tables having no auto-increment column (not created in such way), mimicAI simulates the value of auto-incremented like column to be taken into account when performing INSERT operation.

      • IDLink

        private java.lang.String IDLink
        Link column name used in a WHERE clause for a specific select operation. For example: ID=1; ID=IDLink, 1=IDValue.

      • IDValue

        private java.lang.String IDValue
        Link value used in a WHERE clause for a specific select operation. For example: ID=1; ID=IDLink, 1=IDValue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseAgentSupport

        public DatabaseAgentSupport(java.sql.Connection con,
                            java.lang.String primaryKey,
                            java.lang.String tableName)
        Constructor. DatabaseAgentSupport is related to a specific table in database. The name of the table as well as its primary key (fake or not) must therefore be known. The connection to database must also be known in order to perform SQL tasks.
        Parameters:
        con - The connection to the database
        primaryKey - the primary key column name
        tableName - the table name from database.

        public int getUsefullColumnCount()
        Return the number of columns in table WITHOUT the auto-increment (primary key) column.
        Useful when constructing column_values for insert/update without having to remember the column count. E.g. column_values = new String[getUsefullColumnCount()].

        the result

        public boolean isHasValidAIColumn()
        Returns:
        true if table was created with auto-increment column.

      • setHasValidAIColumn

        public void setHasValidAIColumn(boolean hasValidAIColumn)
        If table was created with auto-increment column, hasValidAIColumn must be set to true. If set to false, then the fake primaryKey will act as if it would be auto-incremented.
        Parameters:
        hasValidAIColumn - hasValidAIColumn

      • getPrimaryKeyColumnIndex

        public int getPrimaryKeyColumnIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of auto-incremented (usually primary key) column

      • setLinks

        public void setLinks(java.lang.String IDLink,
                     java.lang.String IDValue)
        Sets links used in a WHERE clause for a specific select operation. For example: ID=1; ID=IDLink, 1=IDValue. If links are not null, then the select operation with WHERE clause is used!
        Parameters:
        IDLink - the column name link
        IDValue - the value corresponding to column name link

      • resetLinks

        public void resetLinks()
        Reset links to NO links

        Sets row in JTable to be highlighted after update method.
        Parameters:
        selectedRow - the selected row

        public javax.swing.JTable getMainTable()
        Returns:
        the JTable object holding data from database

      • performSelection

        public void performSelection(java.lang.String orderbyS)
        Performs selection in database table and sorts data by desired column. If link members (IDLink and IDValue) are not null, then a SELECT query with WHERE clause is performed. Otherwise, the SELECT all from database is used. Of course, ORDER BY clause is presented in either cases.
        Parameters:
        orderbyS - the ORDER BY column name

      • select

        public void select(java.lang.String command)
        Generic SELECT query is performed here. It can be used for searching in database table.
        Parameters:
        command - the generic SQL select query

      • insertAll

        public void insertAll(java.lang.String[] value)
        Inserts a row in database table using all columns and all their values. The value passed here must be in order relative to the columns of the table. For instance a table with columns: ID, UserName, Password the value array to be inserted must be: {ID_value, userName_value, password_value}.
        SOMETIMES IS USEFUL TO NOT HAVE A VALID PRIMARY KEY COLUMN SINCE A COMBINMATION OF COLUMNS IS UNIQUE. THIS IS THE CASE FOR NESTED TABLES WHICH DOES NOT HAVE ANY NESTED TABLES TTHEMSELVES. MOREOVER, IT IS USEFUL WHEN NESTED TABLE HAS HUGE ROWS (E.G. HpGe SPECTRUM DETAIL OF CHANNELS AND PULSES WHICH CAN HAVE 16000 ROWS OR MORE). IN THIS CASE IT IS POINTLESS TO HAVE A COLUMN AS PRIMARY KEY SINCE ROWNUMBER COLUMN PLUS LINK COLUMN (LINK TO MAIN SPECTRUM TABLE) IS UNIQUE.
        Parameters:
        value - the array of values to be inserted

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String[] value)
        Inserts a row in database table using columns and their values other than primary key column name and value. The value passed here must be in order relative to the columns of the table. For instance a table with columns: ID, UserName, Password having ID as auto-incremented primary key, the value array to be inserted must be: {userName_value, password_value}
        Parameters:
        value - the array of values to be inserted

      • insert

        private void insert(java.lang.String tabel,
                    java.lang.String[] cvalue,
                    java.lang.Integer[] tvalue,
                    java.lang.String[] value)
        Inserts a row in database table.
        Parameters:
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        cvalue - the array of column names
        tvalue - the array of column types
        value - the array of values to be inserted

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String[] value,
                   java.lang.String IDValue)
        Updates a row using columns and their values other then primary key column name and value where primary key column has "IDValue" value. The value passed here must be in order relative to the columns of the table. For instance a table with columns: ID, UserName, Password having ID as auto-incremented primary key, the value array to be updated must be: {userName_value, password_value}
        Parameters:
        value - the array of values to be updated
        IDValue - the reference value for corresponding primary key column

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String tabel,
                   java.lang.String[] cvalue,
                   java.lang.Integer[] tvalue,
                   java.lang.String[] value,
                   java.lang.String IDLink,
                   java.lang.String IDValue)
        Updates a row where a specific IDLink column name has a specific value IDValue.
        Parameters:
        tabel - the table where to perform this operation
        cvalue - the array of column names where values will be updated
        tvalue - the array of column types where values will be updated
        value - the array of values to be updated
        IDLink - the reference column name used as link
        IDValue - the reference value for corresponding IDLink column
